info.title: ietf-netconf-notifications
info.description:
This module defines a YANG data model for use with the
     NETCONF protocol that allows the NETCONF client to
     receive common NETCONF base event notifications.

     Copyright (c) 2012 IETF Trust and the persons identified as
     the document authors.  All rights reserved.

     Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or
     without modification, is permitted pursuant to, and subject
     to the license terms contained in, the Simplified BSD License
     set forth in Section 4.c of the IETF Trust's Legal Provisions
     Relating to IETF Documents
     (http://trustee.ietf.org/license-info).

     This version of this YANG module is part of RFC 6470; see
     the RFC itself for full legal notices.

**IETF Standard YANG Model**
**Module:** `ietf-netconf-notifications`
**Paths:** 8

get.description:
An edit record SHOULD be present for each distinct
         edit operation that the server has detected on
         the target datastore.  This list MAY be omitted
         if the detailed edit operations are not known.
         The server MAY report entries in this list for
         changes not made by a NETCONF session (e.g., CLI). (collection)

post.description:
Add a new entry to An edit record SHOULD be present for each distinct
         edit operation that the server has detected on
         the target datastore.  This list MAY be omitted
         if the detailed edit operations are not known.
         The server MAY report entries in this list for
         changes not made by a NETCONF session (e.g., CLI). (collection)

         if the detailed edit operations are not known.
         The server MAY report entries in this list for
         changes not made by a NETCONF session (e.g., CLI).

get.description: List of capabilities that have just been added. (collection)

post.description: Add a new entry to List of capabilities that have just been added. (collection)

get.description: List of capabilities that have just been added.

put.description: Create or replace List of capabilities that have just been added.

patch.description: Partially modify List of capabilities that have just been added.

delete.description: Delete List of capabilities that have just been added.

get.description: List of capabilities that have just been deleted. (collection)

post.description: Add a new entry to List of capabilities that have just been deleted. (collection)

get.description: List of capabilities that have just been deleted.

put.description: Create or replace List of capabilities that have just been deleted.

patch.description: Partially modify List of capabilities that have just been deleted.

delete.description: Delete List of capabilities that have just been deleted.

get.description:
List of capabilities that have just been modified.
         A capability is considered to be modified if the
         base URI for the capability has not changed, but
         one or more of the parameters encoded at the end of
         the capability URI have changed.
         The new modified value of the complete URI is returned. (collection)

post.description:
Add a new entry to List of capabilities that have just been modified.
         A capability is considered to be modified if the
         base URI for the capability has not changed, but
         one or more of the parameters encoded at the end of
         the capability URI have changed.
         The new modified value of the complete URI is returned. (collection)

get.description:
List of capabilities that have just been modified.
         A capability is considered to be modified if the
         base URI for the capability has not changed, but
         one or more of the parameters encoded at the end of
         the capability URI have changed.
         The new modified value of the complete URI is returned.

put.description:
Create or replace List of capabilities that have just been modified.
         A capability is considered to be modified if the
         base URI for the capability has not changed, but
         one or more of the parameters encoded at the end of
         the capability URI have changed.
         The new modified value of the complete URI is returned.

patch.description:
Partially modify List of capabilities that have just been modified.
         A capability is considered to be modified if the
         base URI for the capability has not changed, but
         one or more of the parameters encoded at the end of
         the capability URI have changed.
         The new modified value of the complete URI is returned.

delete.description:
Delete List of capabilities that have just been modified.
         A capability is considered to be modified if the
         base URI for the capability has not changed, but
         one or more of the parameters encoded at the end of
         the capability URI have changed.
         The new modified value of the complete URI is returned.

target.description:
Topmost node associated with the configuration change.
           A server SHOULD set this object to the node within
           the datastore that is being altered.  A server MAY
           set this object to one of the ancestors of the actual
           node that was changed, or omit this object, if the
           exact node is not known.

operation.description:
Type of edit operation performed.
           A server MUST set this object to the NETCONF edit
           operation performed on the target datastore.

target.description:

           set this object to one of the ancestors of the actual
           node that was changed, or omit this object, if the
           exact node is not known.

operation.description:
Type of edit operation performed.
           A server MUST set this object to the NETCONF edit
           operation performed on the target datastore.
